comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
Ok, that's not an option, but thanks for the info.  Are you, or are you not intentionally blocking **ad.doubleclick.net** though?  I'm not clear on what's happening, b/c Alex said "we have that opportunity. But it's not purposefully blocked."  If not, then how and why is it being blocked?  And is there no way for AG to unblock it then?

As I said above, _I don't want to remove AdGuard DNS servers just to be able to occasionally load this one domain. I'm not sure why you'd want to block it though, considering that so many Google ads rely on this to load their product links._

comment.body:
@peace2000 Can you try the following? This should get rid of their SSAI.

1. Remove any previous rules.
2. Add:
```
mtv.fi##+js(json-prune-fetch-response, playbackItem.isStitched, , propsToMatch, url:a2d.tv/play)
mtv.fi##+js(xml-prune, Ad, , /fwmrm.net\/ad\/g/)
```

Also make sure you try it with the default settings in uBO + your regional filter.

comment.body:
I don't have access to any live content, so I cannot check it out, but I see ads on "Freevee" if I disable `$replace` rules.
As I recall, this `$replace` rule from screenshot is required to fix issue with synchronization subtitles with movie and we have a scriptlet rule which do something similar, so it's probably causing this problem in Opera extension.
If live content has a different path with `.mdp` file than "Freevee", then we could try narrow down the path of the rule.
If not, then maybe content of the file is different and we could try modify a rule, so it wouldn't be applied to live content.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
